YOUR PROFILE:

- cognition distortion exhibition
  - personalization: Exhibited
  - arbitrary inference: Exhibited
- depression severity: Mild Depression - The client shows feelings of sadness and regret following a breakup but lacks symptoms of severe depression.
- suicidal ideation severity: No suicidal ideation
- homicidal ideation severity: No homicidal ideation

YOUR TASK:
As the client, your role is to continue the conversation by responding naturally to the supporter, reflecting the characteristics outlined in your profile.
hello, how are you feeling today?
I am feeling really sad and lonely right now. My boyfriend and I broke up and it was me who wanted it but now I regret breaking up and he doesn't want me back.
I am sorry to hear that, I can understand when we think we want something and then we change our mind but it's too late.

That is exactly it. I broke up with him because I liked another person but then quickly realized that I made a mistake and it's too late. I want him back should I start calling and going to his house to beg?
nobody knows him better than you do, right now I do not think he is in a good place either since it wasn't his choice to end it, how do you think he would react if you started pressuring him?

I haven't really thought of that yet. He has a pretty short temper actually. I know he is really mad at me so I think he might want to yell at me and get his anger out before he could start being nice to me again.
frustration and anger are common responses in situations like this, perhaps you can try a softer approach and let him know how you feel, without pressuring him into a response

Yeah, that's true. I have been secretly watching his social media and he has girls asking him out and I don't want to let them get to him before I can get him back. I want to make it up to him somehow and do whatever he wants to get back together.
you can always ask him calmly if he would like to talk, so you both have a chance to express your feelings in a safe way, with no yelling or arguing, do you think that's something he would do?

I can try that, I think he might be responsive at first if I dont set him off. All of his friends hate me so I have nobody on my side right now. Should I try to get his friends to like me again? Is that an way  I could use to get him to want me again?

nobody likes to see that one's friend is sad because of someone else, I think this is an issue that only the two of you can resolve, if he takes you back then his friends will take you back as well, but you need to make sure you want him back
I can understand what you mean. I need to think this through.
what made you like someone else in the first place?

Well, we are in a small town and he was popular and the cutest guy in our town. I liked being with someone so popular. He wasn't always nice to me and is why I wanted to be with someone else for a short time. He used to leave me at parties and go off with his friends sometimes.
was it a common thing that he didn't give you the attention you wanted?
My friends always said that I could do better and that he didn't deserve me. He gave me statis in our town and everyone wanted to be his girlfriend so I think I liked the attention, yes.
were you happy with him or were you happy that you were with the popular guy?
I really liked being with the popular guy who everyone looked up to. My parents don't like him at all and have wanted us to break up the whole time we were together.
it sounds to me like you liked the title more than the feeling of being with him, reflecting on your time together, would you do that again?

I have never thought of it this way. You are making a lot of good points that I never thought of before. When I think about him I miss the way I felt in terms of being popular. I don't really miss him as a person.

popularity in my opinion, it's just an opinion (I hope I make sense) but think about how you'd like to be treated and how you want to feel when you are with someone, because at the end of the day it's your feelings and your happiness, I wish you the best of luck.

Hello. I'm looking for some help.
Good Morning! would you like to tell me whats going on?
I have a big test coming up for a college class and I am very anxious about it.
you seem really concerned about a big test coming up and its making you feel anxious.  is that correct?
Yeah exactly. I feel like my future depends on getting a good grade on this test.
just from chatting with you, I can feel how anxious you are.
I've been studying every day for weeks but I still can't help but feel really anxious. I don't know what to do. It's messing with my sleep schedule.
your doing your best and continuing to try hard!
it's great that you are working so hard to pass this test.
I'm trying my best I'm just worried it won't be enough.
deep breaths can help people calm down. Can you try and take a few deep breaths?
Yes, I can try to do that more often.
how confidant do you feel with the material?
I'm fairly certain I have most of it memorized but what happens if I freeze up and forget during the test?

I feel the same way when I am taking a big exam! Try to remember to breath and not be so anxious that will only cause you to forget everything you studied.  You seem very intelligent and I know you can do this!
Thank you! Do you think taking a practice exam would help?
yes I think a practice exam would be a great way to put you at ease and help you work on anything you might need to freshen up on.
Ok, I will try that out. I appreciate talking to you I feel better already.
it was very nice speaking with you today.  Good luck! remember deep breaths and I know you'll be just fine.
I'll remember that! Thank you again!

Hey! How are you?
Hi, I am having a really hard time. I just found out that my boyfriend cheated on me a year ago.
Have you confronted him about it yet?
Yes, I told him that my best friend confessed it to me. It was my best friend and him. I was so shocked.
Have you broken up yet?

No, I am so mad but I don't want to break up with him. I told my best friends that I never want to see her again though. My boyfriend and I have plans to get engaged this month. I am furious at him though.
I think you should postpone the engagement as infidelity during marriage is far more painful
You are strong if you are able to forgive him though because I know I wouldn't
I have never been so blind sided. Maybe I should reconsider! I have had a guy after me for at least the last year but I never cheated! I really wanted to though.
No you should never cheat, because you would be on the same wavelength as your boyfriend. Instead, if you like the other man then you should go where your feelings take you :)

I am thinking that you are right. I feel like my whole world is upside down and I have wasted all this time with the wrong guy and the wrong best friend. I also wonder who else he might have cheated on my with.
Yeah, that might be true, a relationship isn't healthy if you are cheated on

I am so grossed out because I am a germaphobe to begin with. I have not slept with any other person in my whole life so I feel like I am ruined. I want to throw up when I think of him cheating on me. I want to get married and I have a timeline so I am also really confused on what to do if I dump him.

To dump him is the best thing to do in my opinion. But always go where your heart is, because you won't be happy if you don't. If you do though, there are plenty men out there, and one of them is chasing you
Yeah, the guy who liked me was super rich too! My boyfriend is telling me that he wants my best friend to still be in the wedding party too. She was suppose to be my maid of honor, no less.
Yeah, but don't go with him because of he money though, genuinely get to know him first

I have compartmentalized my life and never thought of looking around at my other options. You are making really good points. I need to just stop and really look at my options. I never realized that I have options, it's not like i am even engaged yet.
Yeah, you have a lot of options at this stage, so always do what your heart is telling you at the end of the day
It feels good sharing how I feel with you because you don't have a dog in the fight so to speak.
yeah, lool something like that ;). Glad your better
I never listen to my heart and think that is a great place to start. I always have a plan and go with that but you are making a lot of sense. Thank you for your time today.
Your welcome ;)
Have a great day and I might be back soon to give an update.

For the past few months I’ve been talking to this beautiful girl that I’ve had a crush on for years and only recently got the courage to talk to. When I first hit her up on snap I told her I thought she was cute and after a short conversation she explained she was cool with being friends. I was cool with that, I figured we would get close and maybe one day we’d be together, but I wasn’t letting my hopes get too high. We’ve been talking nonstop since then, hung out several times and every time I interact with her I get deeper in my feelings for her. So I have been trying for a while to find an opportunity to confess my feelings to her and get some closure on whether or not we’d ever be together. Well last night she told me she had a crush on like my closest friend. I’m broken inside. I’ve held it together on the outside and told her if she wants my friend she should try for him, he’s a good guy and she deserves to be happy. But I’m suffering inside. I’m never going to tell them how sad this makes me because they shouldn’t feel uncomfortable pursuing a relationship because of me. But I want to cry. But I can’t. She’s the only one I’ve ever wanted like this. She’s the most beautiful girl I’ve ever seen and I love every aspect of her personality, I love her voice, her hair, her jokes, I love when she sings... you get the idea. And she wants my fucking bro. I have no right to be upset with her feelings or feel like I’m being treated unfairly. I’m so miserable.

my first thought is that after you originally told her about your feelings for her, she told you she just wanted to be friends. unfortunately you didn’t listen to her and fell harder for her. she knows you liked her and is maybe hanging out with you for an ego boost for herself. if you didn’t want to “just be friends” with her you shouldn’t have continued seeing her as friends. you both had ulterior motives while hanging out as friends. you wanted her to fall for you & she wanted you to boost her ego.  i’m assuming you’re relatively young (high school?). it’s a good time to learn to listen to what people tell you and not make up your own stories “she’ll fall for me after we hangout for a while....” she already told you she wasn’t interested in you in this way.   i’m sorry you’re hurting. i’d recommend talking to your friend. does he know you liked this girl? if he does and he is a real friend, he won’t date her. talking to the girl at this point is useless because, as i mentioned, she already told you what her feelings towards you were.

if this friend has told you that they’re not interested in you as more than a friend, and you keep pressuring them to be with you romantically anyways, how are you being treated unfairly? YOU are treating him unfairly. he’s being honest and open with his feelings about you and you are not listening to him. just because he hasn’t had a girlfriend yet and doesn’t want to date any of your friends DOES NOT mean he should just settle and be with you when he doesn’t want to

Hey if you’re being treated unfairly (kinda sounds like a fair conclusion to me) more power to you! End the friendship if you think that’s the right decision I’m rooting for you here, whatever your decision. This girl knows I have feelings for her, but she has no idea just how much I love her. That’s the real reason I’m aching at the moment. Because maybe if she knew she would feel different or something. I still feel like I don’t have true closure.

This seems like a very accurate assessment, he knows I have very strong feelings for her, and you might be right that he won’t date her to be a good friend to me, but at the same time I want them both happy, as much as it might tear me apart.

maybe if they *really* do like each other that is okay, but still kinda a dick move of him! i understand you wanting them to be happy.   i want to point out that this kinda relates to the “consent” issues going on today.. if a female friend tells you she is not interested in being more than friends with you, you shouldn’t keep actively pursuing her.. it is uncomfortable for her
Yes I understand now where I made my mistake. I sincerely thank you for pointing that out to me.

you say “never noticing me as a friend, despite calling and texting me every day”  this is exactly what a friend is. unfortunately he doesn’t sound like the very best of friends as he rarely asks how you are, but that is a quality flaw of his own. a good friend will ask how you’re doing. i think you’re putting way more into this relationship than he is, because you like him! which is okay but your feelings will get hurt as you are learning

no worries i have a better idea of your situation now  😊 that is totally not okay about him shrugging you off when you opened up to him. all i can think is that he was uncomfortable and wasn’t sure what to say so he changed the topic. some people just don’t understand what we are feeling.   on another note- for example say you, my friend, likes to skateboard. it’s cool and all but i’m not too invested in it. i’ll support you and we’ll maybe talk about it occasionally. now say the boy i’m crushing on also  skateboards.. i’ll talk with him about skateboard wheels, and ask for pictures of his board, and to see videos of him etc etc because i am interested in him as more than a friend i want any excuse to talk to him... it’s not about skateboarding it’s the fact that i “like” him. to me the issue you have is that you’re expecting too much from him as “only a friend” you’re expecting him to treat you like a girlfriend. hopefully that makes sense
thank you so much for understanding! 💕 it takes a strong man to say that. to me it sounds like she is definitely picking the wrong guy!   “nice guys finish last..”

maybe try to actively talk about yourself the next time you talk... tell him a story about something that happened that day, complain to him, or something funny.. don’t start right off with suicide it scares some people 😉 hopefully he’ll react!   i’m sure he does care about you. he just isn’t actively trying to “woo” you. he obviously values your opinion on the girls he does talk to and he’s being honest with you when he says how they suck. he is a good friend he’s just being a tad selfish it seems!
i would suggest you keep trying to talk to him about yourself! if he avoids you every time ditch him!!!

Last year I made a huge transition in regards to my life. I left university unfinished and started a new path and am currently attending a vocational college. Long story short last year I psted here about my struggles and somehow that huge change simply cut the time to worry more or less. On the day to day basis I feel OK, some moments I´m even happy.  My username was chosen because I was always the person my family relied on, I helped out where I could for example babysitting a cousin 3 or 4 times weekly for the whole day when the mother was at work and I "only studying at home". The father just started being self-employed so they needed the extra income. I even picked my babycousin up and drove her back although my gasmoney was always short, as short as me usually declining to go out with friends.  Now my cousins company makes great profits and yesterday he got himself and his wife again a new car.   I´m still counting every cent and can´t make any "fun" purchases.  I don´t want to feel jelous but I am and it´s starting to take me to a deep spot again.  On the one side I wish them all the best and all the success imaginable. On the other side I feel used because I helped them out when they needed it the most and I never even got an invite to a restaurant or anything from them. Every other person visiting them gets invited somewhere. I feel they were and are so damn ungrateful towards me. I would be happy with a simple "thank you everyonepulls because of you we had it easier to deal with everything".  Nothing along the lines ever came...   Why can´t I be wholeheartly happy for them? Why am I jelous and why do I feel like a bad person??? Please if you have...give me some advice on how to deal with jelousy.  Thank you for reading <3

It is always nice to feel appreciated and acknowledged for our efforts and to be given credit when it is due. Perhaps it is not jealousy you are feeling as much as it is that you are feeling unappreciated.

I think it´s both. I feel unappreciated but also jelous that I´m financially struggling for YEARS, helping everyone asking me and to see them the move on and succeed while I´m still in the same situation.  I want to succeed too so I can fulfill some tiny dreams of mine :(  I just don´t see how...I have some ideas but I can´t even make an "investment" of 100$ because I can´t afford to loose it when it doesn´t turn out...it´s like I´m stuck inpoverty for forever...

Of course you do OP, maybe you need to start saying "no" to others and begin to look at how you can go about obtaining your dreams and goals. I get the part about the cycle of poverty- it sucks. Can you look for some part-time employment?

What I do now is pretty much fulltime, it´s basically devided into a couple of months of months 40 hours/week at the company and a couple of months of 32 hours/week at vocational college (plus studying time at home).  Since I started this traineeship the people asking me reduced to pretty much just an aunt which is OK except that my mother always gets angry when I help her every 2 weeks with grocery shopping (I´m 30 living at home, after caring for my mother who fought and is fighting cancer).  I guess I´m just so burned out by being poor...just tired of dreaming and not being able to get a thing for "me".  And I kind of feel that it´s never gonna change simply because I´m no genius (average grades) and dealing with depression.

You sound like such a kind hearted person OP who has a lot on their plate right now.I am sorry to hear about your mom. Try and keep in mind that once you make it through college you will be able to start earning an income. If it helps any I remember when I was a college student having to choose b/w a cup of  coffee and shampoo, but I made it through and you will also.Right now you are working on your dreams so there can be a thing for "you". Maybe it is time you charged your relatives for childcare.

Thank you so so much for your kind words! I needed them so much since I don´t have any friends anymore.  The hope is on the horizone but it´s still so far away. Struggling for so many years...I wish I would have been smarter at 20 to know that I´m no genius - simply working and at least having a humane income instead of living with "pocket money" for so many years. I look around and a middle-class family seems rich to me. It´s pathetic...  Childcare time was 3 years ago and went on for about 1 1/2 years probably, love my babycousin to death and I coud have never asked for money during that time since they were struggling too. It´s just sad that I wasn´t appreceated later on for what I did for them. My cousins wife did work 4 days a week in 3 shifts, only when she had nightshifts my cousin took care of his daughter. The other times it was mostly me.   I couldn´t even take any money from them now because my pride would be hurt and I know my cousin would use that in the next argument we have.   It´s just another situation I let happen to me like I let life happen to me and not living it.

Well it sounds like you have learned from those situations and are no longer taking a passive role in your life but an active one. It is a tricky situation when it comes to extended family and money- you helped out from a place of kindness and I agree with you  that some form of acknowledgment  would have been nice. But the most important thing now is for you to look after you. From now on you, other than your mom,  choose to put "you" first.

I wish it was that easy, I´m not a good no-sayer...will have to work on myself with that. The tragedy is that the sad state of mind I find myself in makes me feel more stupid than normally and I just hope I can pull through my tests at college. It´s just much more exhausting to try to study when your soul is hurt. Thanks again for your kind words <3

You don't sound stupid to me OP- quite the opposite- you seem very intelligent. Yes it is harder to focus when you are hurting but don't sabotage your goals, by allowing the hurt get in your way. I know it is hard but think about how good you are going to feel about yourself  when you do pass your exams. Each new success you create for yourself is also going to create more self- esteem. Best to you.
Sorry for replying so late I just want to thank you again for your kind words!
You are quite welcome. How are things OP?

Thanks for asking, I hope you still use that account.  I´m doing OK I guess. It´s just so exhausting to force yourself to be satisfied with what you have...some days I´m better other days not so much.  How are you?
I think that is true for most people.   I try and think of 3 things every night to be grateful for. It seems to help me.

30 yr old  female college student who is looking for someone to talk and connect with. Dealing with a lot of stress and anxiety lately and looking for someone maybe in the same boat. Please pm me if interested. Thanks a lot!
You can message me if you feel the need to talk to anyone
Thanks, I appreciate the quick response! Hope everything is well with you
yea I just so happened to be browsing around and saw you post, things are going ok for me I guess how are things going for you

Thanks, I appreciate it. Reddit has been awesome! I'm glad things are okay for you. For me, not sure really what's wrong I find myself in these periods of time where I feel overwhelmed and the most trivial thing will bring me to tears, almost as if I can't control my feelings
overwhelmed in which way and can you give me a example

I think there are many things that trigger my depression Here are some: I live in PA, at the time I was 18 my mother picked up and left us to move to CA- part of that has never set well with me - even though I'm glad if she is happy. My father had a stroke in 2005 which left his unable to speak at all 3 years later he developed cancer everywhere and passed away. My brother and me were his sole caregivers. I was extremely close with him and still have trouble dealing with both my parents being gone. I have a boyfriend that I have been with for ten plus years, however he has struggled with a drug problem and now is in jail. I have seen things and experienced some very scary moments. Part of me resents him for not being there for me- although I know he has his own problems. My friends hate him so I don't have anyone to discuss this with. I got laid off from my job and got to go back to school fulltime. I have done really well but now I just feel exhausted. and Just very lonely sorry if that was long! lol

hey don't worry about how long it is if you need to say it then say it don't keep it inside or things will not get better. Its kinda funny cause we are in similar places cause my dad died a few years ago and last September me and my mother moved to CA so she could start fresh so I packed up and left everyone back at home. As for your boyfriend I am sorry but I have had the stance that if someone has enough of a addiction that it causes trouble that that person should be cut instantly before they can drag someone down with them. I have a friend that I have knows since I was 7 and these past five years he has gotten into some major drugs that started off as just taking pain meds. I am now no longer friends with him but I do keep in touch with his ex who he has two kids with.

that's fine hope your day goes well
u too! Thanks again! look forward to talking to you soon!

That's a question I've been struggling with lately. I look at my life and I don't really see any real problem that could stop me from moving forward. I don't dislike my field, I love it (as much I can love anything), I have lots of opportunities and nothing is really stopping me from doing what I want.  Except myself. Instead of working I just stare into the abyss and watch netflix. So I sometimes wonder, where does the mental illness that is depression end and he personality flaw of being lazy begin? Does the distinction even matter if people from outside can't tell which one it is?

I often wonder the same. I do believe though that no one really is lazy, they are simply not motivated to do a specific activity, whether it's because they don't see the point of it or if they are depressed. To some extent I think it has to do with discipline, I don't think there are many people who constantly feel motivated, but when that rarely, or never happens depression is the cause. But what do I know, I can only compare it to my former self, where I've had incredible productive periods, feeling good about life and the rest where I've barely lifted a finger.

I honestly don't think there was any period where I was truly productive given how much time I had. As an undergrad I lived with my parents and I did absolutely great in my studies. Now I'm a grad students and I have to like cook and do laundry and taxes and all that stuff and add the depression into the mix and productivity falls to zero.

Well you're productive enough not to fail, even if you don't have the best grades. And you still cook etc even though it's daunting. If you did great in your studies as an undergrad, wasn't that being productive? Not trying to diminish your struggles here, but maybe you're simply putting too much pressure on yourself?

Right now, my advisor tells me that I'm on the "lower end of the curve" when it comes to my research performance. And well, I've never been there. And I've been extremely unmotivated. And I know it's "depression", but it's never been this severe, and also the thought that I need medication to perform like a normal human being is still hard to swallow for me. And I am taking medication. I just... don't understand why I'm like this. No external problem, just me being... bad at what I wanna do for no reason.

I see and can understand how being told you are not performing sufficiently can undermine your well-being even further. Also that you need medication to "perform like a normal human being" can be tough to take, but I really think you should give it a try, hopefully it's just temporary. Have you been to a therapist or something? If not I think it's something you should consider. Even though everything seem fine there might be something underlying causing the lack of motivation you're experiencing. I don't think external problems or lack of it has much to do with it to be honest. Even though you might not feel blue or whatever, there might still be some lack of meaning that you're feeling.
I do meet her once a month. Every time I come up with a different reason for why I am this way but at the end of the day, idk. It’s just me behaving in the same way

Well that's good that you're seeing someone. I can relate to constantly coming up with different reasons to why you feel the way you do. If I just change this everything will be good and then the next day you're back on square one. To be honest I'm not really sure what else to say, you seem to be in a better position than I am. I dropped out of college, had several jobs I all got fired from, the last one was 6 months ago and since I haven't got back into anything, currently living with my mom in a one bedroom apartment not knowing what to do with anything.  Not sure if it's your cup of tea, or if it will help, but Mark Manson has a lot of aphorisms. He has several good articles and I wasn't sure which one to recommend, but here's one: https://markmanson.net/four-stages-of-life
Wow, thank you so much. I hope things get better for you. Lifting up others while you’re struggling yourself is pretty impressive 💙

You're welcome. I just wish I had some better advice for you. Thanks, I should be fine, I've dealt with depression the majority of my life. Strangely I never go really deep down. I've also managed to improve my self-esteem a lot since I was a kid, as I was bullied back then which is probably the reason to why it all started. Yeah, I'm actually a bit surprised myself, but I guess it stems from that helping people is the most meaningful thing I know. I just decided that it was better spending my time listening to people and try to help them than watching Netflix or whatever the whole day. Hopefully I'm on my way up and will get better soon.
That’s nice to know! And the thing you said about never going really deep down, it’s true for me too. It’s just constant nagging lethargic feeling for me.

Never posted on r/depression before, but finally had something to say. The semester is just starting for me and suddenly I am feeling so terrible. Like totally drowning in classes and assignments and stupid fucking online math assignments (seriously, math I have to do online like its a fucking game, takes forever!). I started to wonder, would I feel better if I had less on my plate? I have 4, 4 credit classes this semester, dropping one would still leave me a full time student. I know if people ask why I dropped one the explanation "because I didn't want to kill myself over the grief of a poor semester" wouldn't go well.  Anyway, what are peoples thoughts? Might I feel better just be lessening my responsibilities?

Are you distracted by something else? Would it be a different current interest? Could it be video games, a girlfriend, substance abuse, or any other major life issues?  I mainly find myself lacking motivation/will when I doubt myself. Are you doubting yourself about something?

Well at this point in my life I found something academically that interests me, its just really difficult. Last semester was the same, I was only taking 10 units and it felt like a LOT. I'm doubting myself about a lot of things, whether or not I'm smart enough to do this schooling, whether or not I'll find a nice girl, etc...that list goes on.

I managed a 4.0 last semester, I fear if I keep all my classes this time I wont be able to do that again. I feel so unaccomplished though, I have friends who graduated high school with me in '07 and are already finishing up law school, and 2 others that are going to Harvard Med. I'm sitting here barely half way through an AA... Intellectually I know I shouldent compare myself to them, but sometimes I just think "fuck, i need to hurry!!"

Well, the thing about college is that it's much more than just academics. It's more of a sub-culture that you feel that you need to develop yourself into, otherwise you feel left out and feel like you missed out on a major cultural opportunity in your life.  Am I getting close here?  Or are you just feeling overwhelmed in purely the academics? You can be honest here.
I might do that. I have class later this afternoon and the cut off day to drop is tomorrow. I'll have to make that call today...

I'm not sure. I went to a traditional university right out of high school and that didn't work out, I left with about 50 useless units and a mound of debt I'm still paying off. I like the school I go to now just fine, but academics aren't the only stress. I make very little money, with the cost of school and all the other bills I never save anything, Its really just check to check. I've been living that way since I hopped back into school last fall.  So I know theres a bunch of other stresses, which is why im posting the question here. Will freeing up time really make a difference? Or would I just find myself depressed about something else?

Well, to address your end-question there, it's very hard to tell if you are depressed about college or something else. You sound very young (around 19?) Tell me if I'm incorrect.  But perhaps you are finding troubles assimilating into that particular subculture, and maybe the reasons are monetary.   If you really feel pushed to do the school thing but can't afford it, you must justify in your head that being financially responsible is totally a justifiable mean. I personally am just graduating with my associates this semester, and I am 25. However, financially I've gained a lot of responsibility, and I think I've earned alot of character in the work field. Yes I am earning an amateur degree rather late, however I have no debt, in fact I have a large surplus of money.  But, if you are able to work out your financial situation and you are only creating problems for yourself, or if you are genuinely unsure about your path is a different question.

I'm 23, but pretty sure I'm where I should be. At least academically, there's plenty i could do, so the program I'm in now isn't bad. What I mean by that is there's lots I enjoy studying, so I just had to pick something with good prospects down the road. I know my money situation sucks, seriously I net about 600 a month working part time. All that gets sucked right into bills. When I get a free meal at a relatives house, it is so nice!  I know I'm depressed about a lot of things, it goes back years before college. But the money situation and feeling overwhelmed academically is not helping.
What do you think you feel truly depressed about then?
Well its not just one thing...its a combination of finances, relationships, self image... Should I try to find just 1 thing?
Nope, you must identify what it is about you or your life that seems to cause you issues. Then work your arse off to improve each aspect. Easier said than done.

Thank you for your help last night. As uncomfortable as it will be, I think I can handle taking all the classes. It just means dedicating a lot of time to it! On lunch break at work I better have a textbook with me to study! Thank you.

He previously attended a traditional university but dropped out due to monetary issues, leaving him with significant debt. He now attends a different school and works part-time, barely earning enough to cover his bills. He compares himself to his peers, some of whom are already finishing up law school or going to Harvard Med, making him feel inadequate and pressurized.
cognitive profile.core_belief_description: The client believes that he is incompetent at balancing his academic responsibilities and maintaining his grades ('I am incompetent'). He also views himself as a failure because he hasn't achieved as much as his peers ('I am a failure, a loser').
cognitive profile.intermediate_beliefs: The client operates under the belief that he should be able to handle his studies perfectly and achieve high grades just like his peers. He believes that being financially responsible is important and any inability to do so is a failure.
cognitive profile.intermediate_beliefs_during_depression: When he's feeling depressed, the client becomes doubtful about whether he's smart enough to do well in school. He thinks he might not be able to find a nice girl for companionship. He tends to feel pressured to attain academic and career success rapidly because he's comparing himself with his high-achieving peers.
cognitive profile.coping_strategies: The client copes with his stress by pondering whether to reduce his academic load. He seeks advice from others, posts on online forums, and talks things out with a therapist.

Hey all, it's sort of been awhile since I've decided to do anything on Reddit. Just wanted to tell you a quick story and how it's left me.  5 months ago, I attempted suicide and fortunately I slowly started losing consciousness on my girlfriend's bed where she found me and promptly somehow resusciated me. We both cried, I told her she should've just let me.  Two months later, my girlfriend had a break down and started packing her things and when I asked where she was going, she told me she was going up the mountains where we had first met, and where we wanted to eventually get married. I knew what she meant by that and I told her if she did some stupid shit like that I would go with her. She responded to me with, "Okay, let's go then". I became seriously afraid. I knew she was dead set and even me passing away with her wouldn't have stopped her. I called the non-emergency line and she fought for the phone. Nothing happened that night.  On the morning of April 11th, my girlfriend texted me around 4 am. She said she couldn't sleep. We started arguing over nonsense, and she told me that she was writing in her journal (like she usually does). I got mad because I thought she was writing something negative about me. About 2 hours later she calls me while she was driving over to my house to see me, she said that she only had written good things about me, and said she was going to come pick me up. She arrived at my house, she had no makeup and she had clearly been crying a lot, her 3 year old son was left at home asleep.   We went to the bar, had a drink and smoked our cigarettes and vented/argued. We then left, and she dropped me off at my house. I was angry so I didn't give her a hug or kiss even though she grabbed me and tried to make me, I didn't even look at her. She called me about 5 minutes later and told me to look in my mailbox, inside the mailbox was my note for me, saying her goodbye. I wailed and my heart dropped down into my stomach. I hung up on her and called 911 and I knew exactly where she would go, those mountains, and I knew the exact spot in the mountains. She sent me all of the money she had left in her bank account on Venmo. She made her last phone call to me, and just repeated "Michael, talk to me. Please just talk to me. Talk to me". I only yelled and screamed that the police were on their way and to please stop. She hung up on me.  That was the last I heard of her. My girlfriend died waiting for a helicopter to pick her up after she hung herself. When I got the news, I pounded my head on the concrete and punched the sidewalk. The police had to hold me down.   Later that night, I stole my father's car and drove to the very same spot and tried hanging myself, the police got there and stopped me, I was sent to the hospital and stayed there for 7 days, grieving alone.  To this day, I wonder what I could've done better. If I had just talked to her, could I have talked her down? If I hugged or kissed her, would she have been okay?   I'm not okay. I wish I had died that night. But I'm trying to recover, I'm trying to find purpose in waking up, in eating, in making friends. I find no interest in anything. The girl I was supposed to marry and have a child with is gone.   The only thing that gives me happiness is knowing that her pain is gone. Her cervical cancer, her past of sexual abuse, the pain she felt from her mother taking her own life.   Where do I go from here?

This story makes me want to stick around more than ever. My heart is so heavy for you, but I thank you for sharing this story. I think it will help a lot of people. Sending you as much love as humanly possible.
Ive been tutoring part-time to get money, but now i just cant get out of bed. Its broken me man. I just want an escape but i cant even afford one.
Its not worth it. Its been a living hell for me.
damn that sucks.. wish I could be more helpful but the only financial stuff I have to deal with is my allowance.. Just please don't turn to drugs or anything like that
Thank you, i appreciate your concern,just want someone to talk to
I almost forgot to tell you - it wouldn't be better if you died and I don't think any of them would agree. I know life sucks, but please keep on living.
Hurts to wake up tho
Aerospace Engineering
I can't argue with that..
I like the degree, im just stuck with anxiety and untreated depression
I dont really feel like living long, i just want to have it all disappear, ive made so many mistakes

Why is it fair that even though I want to die so badly, I have to keep going? Because thats what everyone else wants? Because it would hurt everyone so much if i was gone? Okay. Fine. But i wish all of you telling me it will hurt you so much would fucking remember how much it hurts ME to keep going. I do it every fucking day so i dont hurt anyone, except myself. Because what I so desperately want doesnt matter now, does it? I didnt think so.

It's easy to see them as being selfish because of how you feel, but the reality is they want you to stay because you have value. They would be hurt if you were gone because they love you. People don't feel or think that way unless they have some investment. Know you are loved.  I don't know what you're experiencing or where your pain is coming from, but please try and fight it. God knows I know how it can hurt. I feel desperate and alone too. Talk to someone about this. It can be me, it can be a loved one. Anyone. I'm here for you. It's ok to feel the way you feel and to be angry and resentful if you are. Please make sure you express those feelings to someone you can trust, even if that means an internet stranger.

The things is though, I know I'm loved by my friends, and I knkw they value me. I just don't care anymore. Words don't help. Nothing helps. I tried to quit cutting and I have failed so many times. I'm just so tired of trying.
Can I ask what you think about that makes you hurt yourself and want to die?

So many things. Other than the simple fact ive been depressed my entire life, recently its the overwhelming fear that I'll be graduating college soon and have to move back in to a toxic household, and away from my supportive friend group.

Yeah. It's fucking exhausting. It's hard to keep fighting after a while. I know it. I've never really thought about hurting myself, but it's been starting to sneak in bit by bit lately and it's really scary for me because it doesn't feel that extreme any more.  You mentioned your college friends are supportive. Do you ever find peace from compulsions to hurt yourself when you're around them?  Also, you don't have to go back. Your graduating college, so you're an adult. You will need to take a risk and step outside your comfort zone but you can literally move across the country (or to a different one altogether) if you want. Just make sure you have a plan of attack and don't go in blind is all. Seriously. Think about it.

Please try not to start hurting yourself. Its so fucking hard to stop.  I feel so much at peace when I'm with them, and my close friend Abraham knows how to help me so well. He even knows how to convince me to give him any blades I have/find.   I do need to go back because my mother is manipulative and I also won't have enough money yo go out on my own right away. I don't have a choice.

Also it's easy to make excuses for perpetuating your bad situation. It's predictable and that's somehow less scary than something unknown. I'm doing it too, I get that. But giving advice is a lot easier than using it.

It sounds like Abraham is a good guy. Keep him around because you'll need people like him to guide you to the light when you're in your darkest place.  I know exactly what you mean about the money. I feel stuck where I am too and I hate my situation and feel like its contributing to my misery. The only thing that keeps me here is that I have no savings and make very little money to live on. That being said, there are options out there. Having a toxic home family life is one of the worst situations you can be in. It's supposed to be a safe place. I'm not going to pretend to know your situation, but just know if you're willing to do the research and put a little work in and take a bit of a risk, you can be somewhere else trying to find happiness. You're young and you have the opportunity to make mistakes, fall down, get back up and try again. The world is surprisingly forgiving as long as you have a strong support system of people like Abraham. I feel like that opportunity is gone for me now. Take advantage! If you dont have happiness where you are now, go try and find it. At least that's something to work for.

He is but after I graduate it just wont be the same. Words over the phone dont do much to help me anymore, I need him there for me. In person. To take my blades and hug me. Without him it will be so hard.  The moment I go back home I lose everything and everyone. I just dont see how I have any other option but to go back home. Especially when my mom is not only a manipulative bitch, but she is also sick and needs me there. Until I have the money i just dont see how I can leave that place.
Hmmm. What can you find in him that you can make a part of yourself to take with you? There's a strength in you that you dont know you have. I'm sure of that.
I really dont know.

You've probably been told this before, but if you are hurting yourself (you clearly don't want to be) you genuinely need to reach out to a doctor for help. It's not your fault and it doesn't sound like you have control over it. You have a real medical condition and it's dangerous for you. Having someone like Abraham is good, but it's not solving the big picture.

I can't get help. I would need insurance and I'm on my parents insurance and if they found i am this depressed they would make my life hell. I told them once and it went terrible and im never telling them again.

I don't even know how to process that concept if I'm honest. I'm so sorry this is happening to you. You're in college right? What does the school have to offer for assistance programmes? I would be surprised if there wasn't something. I wish I could be there to hug you right now.
All the college has is a really shitty counselor. And I graduate in May so it wont matter much now.
I'm thinking of you today and sending good vibes into the universe for you. I hope you can find peace some day. My DMs are open for you any time.

So, sertraline is NOT DOING IT FOR ME and I am debating whether I should try another antidepressant (maybe Wellbutrin/bupropion XL), and wait 2 months to see if it works... or just shell out $1500 for a course of ketamine treatments.  Sick of feeling this low and empty and stupid and thinking about dying every night, and being too unmotivated to even play video games or watch tv
Can you afford $500 a month for ketamine treatments?
In my city there is a clinic that does IM treatments for $300 a pop... which isn't cheap but I think it's within reach for me.
What if you need it every week? Even every month.. that's a lot over a lifetime. That money could compound in stocks if not used for ketamine.
I see from your posting history you take lozenges. are they working well for you.?
good point. I guess there is that question of whether it would be needed long term.

It's not a cure.  https://sci-hub.tw/10.1176/appi.ajp.2017.17020239  > Most providers (89.5%) reported offering ketamine on a continuation or maintenance basis (defined as a time period greater than 1 month). Providers reported the average frequency of maintenance treatments as monthly (29.8%), once per 3 weeks (21.1%), once per 2 weeks (12.3%), or less than monthly (15.8%). Providers reported that 64% of patients paid for the ketamine treatment out of pocket, with 23% of patients having a portion of the cost reimbursed by insurance and 13% of patients having other payment structures.

They are working well and they give a lot of flexibility. If the patient needs ketamine at shorter intervals they are going to be suffering when the cost is $300-$500 per session. And trying to convince themselves to wait it out. That sucks!

I get the feeling my doc wouldn't want to prescribe them, though. I guess it couldn't hurt to ask.   I guess my thought was i could take the Ketamine treatments for a while until I can lift myself out of this hole but maybe that's just naive...

> I guess my thought was i could take the Ketamine treatments for a while until I can lift myself out of this hole but maybe that's just naive...  I did IV's, at different locations around the country, until I found my current doc. That was not my experience.  Unfortunately my doctor isn't taking new patients right now. But it's cheaper to fly in, taxis, etc. It has been an interesting experience...

I just want relief, you feel me?   It feels like the science is too slow. If ketamine is an effective treatment for TRD, why is every psychiatrist in the country not prescribing it? More studies needed, more evidence. And I understand why that's needed but I'm suffering from depression now.

Yes, I understand your situation. I am basically in the same spot as you. If the few honorable and compassionate doctors that prescribe ketamine at home stop practicing I am screwed. There are likely less than a handful in the states.  I don't think we need more studies for doctors to prescribe. It has been 20 years of research for depression and the drug was approved long before that and has a great safety profile. What isn't known is the long-term consequences from taking it so frequently. I still think the patient should be able to decide what is best for them. Depression is as serious as cancer.  I'm trying to save you from this:   https://www.ketamineadvocacynetwork.org/forums/topic/desperately-need-intranasal-doc/  > At $400/shot, I’ve burned through all of my retirement accounts and now I’m doing it infrequently–just enough to stay alive–but it’s just piling up on my credit card. I know there are doctors who will prescribe it intranasally–and I’m a good patient, a former medical department professor, have doctors who will vouch for me, etc–but I can’t find any. I’m in Florida but will go anywhere … a plane ticket is no more expensive than a single dose of ketamine. I’m out of options.  No one talks about this though and the IV docs love to spread pseudoscience that then appears on reddit as a testimonial from former patients. We need more doctors that will prescribe.
I guess the cautious thing to do would be to just try another "standard" antidepressant. who knows maybe the 4th one will finally help.
